alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Montgomery; Randolph; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northwestern Montgomery, southwestern Randolph and northeastern Stanly Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Badin Lake, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Badin Lake, Badin, Richfield, New London, Newsom, Pinehaven Marina, Eldorado, Fish Tales Marina and Morrow Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
